Name: Cards Against Humanity: Clickhole Greeting Cards Pack
Description: An exclusive pack of 15 cards for Cards Against Humanity included with the box of Clickhole created greeting cards.

Name: Pretty Princess Pomelo
Description:
An all-out battle will ensue between our magical heroes, The Citrine Heirs, and the interdimensional werewolf pirates, The Scurvy Sea Dogs. Build your team, cast your spells, and battle it out to claim the powerful and legendary Citrine Hearts! With strategic turn-based gameplay and destiny altering cards, get ready to take the fate of the universe into your hands!

On their turn, players draw 2 cards from any combination of Decks and play Character, Story or Power cards or activate their abilities. After which they may attack. and then draw down to a maximum 10 cards in their hand.

To win, you must have either a full team of either all heroes or all villains while controlling the Citrine Hearts card. A full team is 5 characters with 2 players, 4 with 3 players, and 3 with 4 players. After this is achieved that player wins the game.

Name: Grit
Description:
In a faraway land, a hero awakens to find the world has changed. The peaceful world seems somehow less peaceful. Word arrives of a corrupting force that has unleashed havoc. Fertile lands turned to sand, animals of the woods growing large and evil and the hearts of mankind being corrupted with power. Signs of this corruption manifest across the land in the form of black splotches. Could this be the work of Tulo Tulodon banished so long ago? Can he be stopped before it’s too late?

Grit is played over a series of games. There's no set path you absolutely need to take to reach the end, so your campaign length will vary. Will you try to explore every inch of the world or crash the end game? Save your progress after each game or a series of games and pick it up at a later time.

Travel around a modular, hidden map as you meet the townsfolk and battle the evil of the land. You must end your game at a checkpoint or you will lose your progress and need to reset to your previous checkpoint.

Locations and events are depicted by QR codes.  QR codes will link to 277 websites with interactions with townsfolk, enemies and the environment. There are standard codes you can access whenever, immediate codes that are forced interactions when they are revealed and dig sites where you spend a stamina to uncover hidden items.

Name: Die-namo
Description:
Die-namo is a quick, fun push-your-luck card n' dice game in which players bet to collect the most cards of a color or number for the highest score at the end of the game.

Game play is simple. On your turn, roll the color die and carry out one of the following actions:

-Collect one card if there are cards in the supply zone matching the color of the die roll.

-Place a bet with the roll of the regular die, if there are no cards in the supply zone matching the color of the die roll, or, if you want to collect more than one card from the supply zone.

If you placed a successful bet you may collect ONE CARD for a single match or ALL CARDS of one color for a double match. However, if you fail, you lose your bet cards.

The game ends when a player completes a set of cards of one color (1 to 6) or before if the supply cards are depleted. The player with the most points is the winner.

Name: Action Dice Hockey
Description:
Instant excitement. Easy-to-play pocket size. Lightning-quick, hockey action in a fast-paced dice game based on America's #1 hockey league!

Action Dice Hockey is a dice solitaire game.

This dice strategy game can take you down the ice for slap shots, wrist shots, penalties and more! Watch out for checks, penalty's, goals and more. It's fast, easy to learn and you call the plays. Perfect for tailgating at games, at the home or in your office, or while traveling on airplanes -- play it anywhere! Any result in the NHL can happen in this game. Call your play, roll the dice and instantly see the results!

This game can be single or two players. To play the game simply choose one of the offensive plays and roll the dice to see the result. Each team gets a chance to move the puck into a scoring range. If you like the range then you can choose to shoot or pass again to increase your range for a better chance to score!

Keeping track of time in this hockey game is easy. Provided are score sheets. Each time a play is finished the user will record a play by checking off a circle on the score sheet. After 30 plays are completed, it will show the final score for that quarter of play. The team with the most goals wins the game. If the score is tied then an overtime quarter will begin.

—description from the publisher

Name: Action Dice Baseball
Description:
Instant excitement. Easy-to-play pocket size. Lightning-quick, baseball action in a fast-paced dice game based on America's #1 past time, baseball!

Action Dice Baseball is a head-to-head dice game that can be played individually, or two players.

This dice strategy game can take you 9 innings! Steal bases, errors, home runs and more.  It's fast, easy to learn and you call the plays. Perfect for tailgating at games, at the home or in your office, or while traveling on airplanes -- play it anywhere! Results in the MLB can happen in this game. Get a hit, roll the dice and instantly see the results!

This game can be single or two players. To play the game simply choose one of the 3 swings and roll the dice to see the result. 9 innings of baseball where each team can hit, steal and bunt for scores. Contact swings, power and bunting will get you on base then it's up to you if you choose to steal bases to increase your chance to score!

Keeping track of time in this baseball game is easy. Provided are score sheets. Each team gets 3 outs per inning just like pro baseball. After 9 innings are completed, the final score will determine the winning team. The team with the most goals wins the game. If the score is tied then extra innings begin.

—description from the publisher

Name: Action Dice Basketball
Description:
Action Instant excitement. Easy-to-play pocket size. Lightning-quick, action in a fast-paced dice game.

Action Dice Basketball is a head-to-head dice game that can be played individually, or two players.

This dice strategy game has passing, shooting, 3 pointers and drives to the hoop for dunks! Watch out for penalties and shooting fouls. 4 quarters of non stop action. It's fast, easy to learn and you call the shots. Perfect for tailgating at games, at the home or in your office, or while traveling on airplanes -- play it anywhere! Call your play, roll the dice and instantly see the results!

Dice Basketball is a head-to-head dice game that can be played individually, or two players.

This game can be single or two players. To play the game simply choose one of the shots roll the dice to see the result.  There are fouls, penalties, free throws, final minute shots and more.  Play conservative with 2 point calls or more risky with 3 point shots, add the score as you go and see who wins.

Keeping track of time in this basketball game is easy. Provided are score sheets. There are 4 quarters of basketball action. After each play is rolled, check off the circle on the score sheet while you add the score and when all the boxes are checked then the quarter is over.  If the score is tied after the 4th quarter then overtime will begin.

—description from the publisher

Name: サクサク・ファーム (Saku Saku Farm)
Description:
Place tiles to encircle your farmland with a white picket fence but beware of UFOs going after your cows.

The game starts with players receiving 4 tiles each. Shuffle the remaining tiles and split them evenly into individual draw piles for each player. Set unused tiles aside.

On each turn, a player draws one tile from their draw pile. From the five tiles in his or her hand, the player choses a tile to place down into their personal farm area. Only the farmland contained within the fence will count for scoring.

Farmland tiles contain different resources that can give you additional points…but some resources, such as a tree stump, can actually subtract from your score.

The player with the highest score wins.

Name: Frequent Flyer
Description:
You and your opponents will fly around the country racing to see who can visit all 20 cities in this family friendly and educational board game. Every time you fly you earn frequent flyer miles as you would in real life traveling between cities.

Players roll the dice to determine their home city.  Once they know their home city, they roll the dice to determine the city they are flying to, and how many spaces they can move. Use your frequent flyer miles to select the city you fly to, upgrade to first class, or take a private jet.

The first player to visit all 20 cities and return back to their home city will be declared the winner.

Name: Psycho Killer: Gratuitous Violence!!!
Description:
Gratuitous Violence is an expansion pack to Psycho Killer. With 15 brand new cards, including ranged weapons, you’d better be ready for some violence!

Cards:

3 of each
Save yourself
Creepy old local

2 of each
I know what you'll do next summer
Crossbow
Hunting rifle
Flame thrower

1 Psycho Creature

Name: Psycho Killer: Z
Description:
Psycho Killer Z is an expansion pack to Psycho Killer. With 15 new cards, including zombie weapons and infections, you’d better start preparing for the zombie apocalypse!

Cards:

1 Patient Zero

2 of each
Cure
Shallow grave
Supply run
Infection
Bite Swarm
Scratch

Name: Dungeon Degenerates: Breaking the Law
Description:
The Wurstreich is crawling with agents of the law who are just as corrupt & distorted (if not moreso) than your anti-hero adventurers & the monsters trying to gain a foothold. We dare you to add an additional thirteen new Monsters to your already brimming Monster Decks!

13 New Cards for use with DUNGEON DEGENERATES: HAND OF DOOM!

Name: Dungeon Degenerates: Goblins Have More Fun
Description:
It's true, Goblins Have More Fun! Goblins are sneakier, stupider, more cunning, lazier, crazier, smaller, more out for a good time, more ready for a fight & more basic. We dare you to add an additional thirteen new Monsters to your already brimming Monster Decks!

13 New Cards for use with DUNGEON DEGENERATES: HAND OF DOOM!

Name: Dungeon Degenerates: Hooray for the Bad Guys
Description:
There are so many monsters in the Wurstreich jostling their way in front of the spotlight. We dare you to add an additional thirteen new Monsters to your already brimming Monster Decks!

13 New Cards for use with DUNGEON DEGENERATES: HAND OF DOOM!

Name: Merchants of Midgard
Description:
Merchants of Midgard is a 2-6 player resource management, deck-building game. The aim of the game is to gain the most points within 10 rounds.

As a human merchant of Midgard, you travel through the nine realms to sell on wares from one realm to another, managing your resources so you aren't left stranded!

You can gain additional route access to other realms, increasing your compensation, as well as hiring servants to help you navigate the treacherous paths!

You always gain resources when you arrive at a new realm, but if enough merchants have gotten their first, then you are going to have to settle for whatever is left.

Name: Power Grid: Europe/North America
Description:
Power Grid: Europe/North America is a pair of expansion maps for Power Grid! Thanks to their special size, these two maps both have seven regions.

The maps were released in 2014 for the tenth anniversary of Power Grid in the standalone base game Power Grid deluxe, which used a completely different graphic style. Now you can finally build your networks in Europe and North America with Power Grid, too!

Name: Power Grid: The New Power Plants – Set 2
Description:
Power Grid: The New Power Plants – Set 2 is a complete set of power plant cards for Power Grid offering two variants to play:


     in place of the original deck
     paired with the original deck (to make for an unpredictable mix) 


The power plants were released in 2014 for the 10th anniversary of Power Grid in the standalone base game Power Grid deluxe, which used a completely different graphic style. Now you can finally supply electricity with them with Power Grid, too!

Name: Hit & Run
Description:
With cards simulating a slot machine, in this game 2 players push their luck to form combinations of symbols that can potentially give them high scores and low penalties.

Additional components required: 2 dice and 3 coins.

Each round, both players will roll their die, and then take cards based on the die rolls. If both players roll the same number, remove one of the 3 coins from the game and roll again. Once players have taken all possible cards, the next round begins.

The game ends when the last card was taken or the last coin was removed from the game. Points are tallied and the player with the high score wins.


Released in the August 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Tactical Commander
Description:
KICKSTARTER NOW!!
kicstarter campaign until February 24, 2024

http://kck.st/3OoX0w3


                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                        
                                                                                                    
                                                                                                
                                                                                            
                                                                                        
                                                                                    
                                                                                
                                                                            
                                                                        
                                                                    
                                                                
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


Tactical Commander is a card-based war game, designed to simulate WWII battles at battalion level, commanding your companies on the battlefield.


Tactical Commander es un juego de guerra basado en cartas, diseñado para simular batallas de la 2GM a nivel batallón, llevando el mando de sus compañías en el campo de batalla.
__________________________________________

Phases of the game:

1st phase to determine the initiative. A dice is thrown and the one that has a higher score begins playing.

2nd phase of reorganization:
Replacement of cards and discards.
Administrative phase (marks)
Committed to cards.

3rd aerial phase. Combat.

4th artillery phase. Combat.

5th Motion Phase:
Operational movement (out of map)
Movement of companies. ( map)
Movement of sections. (Stacking).
Logistic movement of transport.
Overrun (Immobilization of vehicles).

6th tactical combat phase.
Body to body combat.


     The duration of the game can be determined based on one of the following concepts.


- Victoria points. Get victory the first player who reaches an amount of PDV preset by both players.
- Limit of shifts of deck of action. Players agree on a shift limit or how many times you can play the deck of action cards. Win the player who gets more PDV.
- Capture of objectives or hexagons. Win the player who manages to capture all previously agreed objectives or hex-agers.
- Sudden death. If a player does not have avant-garde units on the tactical map, he will lose the battle immediately.

COMPONENTS:

1x Box size 230x220x45mm

60x German side poker size cards, printed 4/4+laminated

60x Russian side poker size cards, printed 4/4+laminated

80x poker size action cards printed at 4/4 + laminated

4x A5 size Cardstock Sheets, printed black and white

1x A4 size board, printed at 4/4 + laminated

3x Sheets of die-cut bookmarks, A4 size printed at 4/4+laminated. DC1.2mm

2x Rules Booklet (english & spanish), A4 Size, 30 Pages Printed in 4/4 inks. 115 Staple Paper

4x 6 sided dice


Secuencia del juego:

1º Fase para determinar la iniciativa.

2º Fase de Reorganización:
Reposición de cartas y descartes.
Fase administrativa (se eliminan contadores)
Puesta en juego (se bajan cartas a la mesa)

3º Fase aérea. Combate aéreo.

4º Fase de artillería. Combate de artillería.

5º Fase de Movimiento:
Movimiento operacional.
Movimiento de Compañías por el mapa.
Movimiento de Secciones. (Apilamiento).
Movimiento logístico de Transportes.
Arrasamientos. (Inmovilización de Vehículos).

6º Fase de combate terrestre.
 Combate Cuerpo a Cuerpo

Condiciones de Victoria:
La duración de la partida puede determinarse en base a uno de los siguientes conceptos:

     Puntos de victoria. Consigue la victoria el primer jugador que alcance una cantidad de PdV prefijada por ambos jugadores.
     Límite de turnos o de mazo de Acción. Los jugadores acuerdan un límite de turnos o cuántas veces se puede jugar el mazo de cartas de Acción. Gana el jugador que consiga más PdV.
     Captura de objetivos o hexágonos. Gana el jugador que consiga capturar todos los objetivos o hexágonos acordados previamente.
     Muerte súbita. Si a un jugador no le quedan Unidades de Vanguardia en el mapa táctico, perderá la batalla inmediatamente. 


COMPONENTES:
CONTROL TÁCTICO:

1x Caja tamaño 230x220x45mm

60x cartas tamaño póquer bando alemán, impresas 4/4+laminadas

60 cartas tamaño póquer bando ruso, impresas 4/4+laminadas

80 cartas de acción tamaño póquer impresas a 4/4 + laminadas

4x hojas de cartulina tamaño A5, impresas en blanco y negro

1x tablero tamaño A4, impreso a 4/4 + plastificado

3x Hojas de marcadores troqueladas, tamaño A4 impresas a 4/4+laminadas. CC 1,2 mm

2x libro de reglas (español e inglés), tamaño A4, 30 páginas impresas a 4/4 tintas. 115 papel grapado

4x dados de 6 caras

Name: You're Fired: IT Guy
Description:
IT Guy (inspired by Moss from The IT Crowd) promo card from Board Game of the Month Club.

Look at the top 2 cards from any player's deck and put them back in any order.


Released in the September 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Trolling for Trouble: Acuity Powder
Description:
An additional item for Trolling for Trouble, Acuity Powder. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the May 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Hast du hunger, kleine Raupe?
Description:
Are you hungry, little caterpillar? 
A game of colors, memory and reactions:

"No, what a delicious, red strawberry and there a crisp green salad and smells like the yellow cheese. It's like in paradise", says the little caterpillar, who is always hungry and eats everything that gets in her way. It is only picky about color. Sometimes she wants to eat something red, sometimes something blue, then again she only likes green or yellow delicacies. And then she searches until she has found something in her favorite color. With every bite the caterpillar eats, it becomes longer and happier. It's the same in this game: in the beginning the little caterpillar is very tiny, actually it only consists of a head and a tail. But the more she eats, the bigger and longer she gets. A treat in a certain color must be found through the color die. The card then - turned around - results in another piece of belly. Who has the longest caterpillar in the end?

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – The Storm and The Fury
Description: You’ve played through the core game, Darkness Calls and The Wild Hunt. Now it’s time to bring the saga to a close with The Storm and The Fury. Armed with a certain magical sword (no spoilers here, just in case), Hellboy must face his toughest foe yet: Nimue in her dragon form. This is the biggest miniature we’ve made for Hellboy: The Board Game and it’s not going to be easy to take her down.

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Hell on Earth
Description: With Hellboy gone, the B.P.R.D. faces a range of horrifying new minions as the world descends into chaos. The Hell on Earth expansion introduces new minions to add to your missions. From swarming Crickets, to demons and Ogdru-Hem mutants, you’re going to wish you were only facing the Frog Monsters from the core game. This expansion includes 15 minion miniatures, the Nesting Site Case File and Encounter cards, plus all the minions can be mixed into existing missions using the previously released B.P.R.D. Archives expansion.

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Pandemonium
Description: In Pandemonium some all-new bosses are here to try and end the world. This expansion includes The Flood Case File, Enemy cards, Unexpected Threat Hammerhead card, Encounter cards and Boss Behaviour Cards.

Name: Quiek Quak Miau
Description:
Players roll 2 dice - 1 with color dots and 1 with arrows.  Players then match up the color and arrow direction to the rows and columns on the their player board and make the sound of the animal they find.

The first player to fill a row or column wins!.

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – End of Days
Description: End of Days includes new playable agents – Ted Howards, Sledgehammer, Evolved Abe Sapien and Flaming Liz Sherman – plus the Eviction Notices Case File, character-specific Deck of Doom cards and Requisition Cards. Use these new agents to tackle the new expansions or return to your favourite missions from the original game and play them again with a fresh cast of heroes.

Name: Swing State Steal: Fake News Expansion Cards
Description:
By Popular request, we've added another pack of 72 fake news cards. In all fairness, this stuff practically writes itself!

There's more fake news where THAT came from. Ready for more stories? How about news on why Math is racist. Or media bias. Or Climate Change. Or cancelled Looney Tunes. The fun never stops! The expansion pack come with a brand new set of 72 news cards to compliment the cards that come with the game.

Relax. It's just a board game.

Name: Trolling for Trouble: Cleric/Thief
Description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Cleric/Thief.  Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the June 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Trolling for Trouble: Umbral Cloak
Description:
An additional item for Trolling for Trouble, the Copper Robot. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the September 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Memo Loto Shop
Description:
It is a introductory memory game and chance for young children.

It's time to go shopping! You have to grab all your four items from your shopping list. Go to different stores and use your memory. Grab a card from the shop, if it is on your list you can pick it. Else you have to put back and other player can take if they remember where it was.

The first player who complete the shopping list will win.

Name: Trolling for Trouble: Shepherd/Brute
Description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Shepherd/Brute.  Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the October 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Trolling for Trouble: Copper Robot
Description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Copper Robot. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the January 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Trolling for Trouble: Changeling
Description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Chageling. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the February 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Elementile
Description:
Elementile - is a tile-based 1v1 card game which rewards key decisions and adaptive play. Utilize 6 base elements with their own strengths and weaknesses to summon units and cast spells on the 4x4 field of play. Gain resources by sacrificing cards from your hand, creating play patterns that vary based on the individual match up and your opponent’s actions.  Each player has full control over their resource pool so the ability to engage is always at their fingertips.  Push your advantage to your opponent’s front door and unleash a powerful attack to win the game!

Get together with friends and draft your decks with our core set – a complete 462 card cube intended for drafting with 138 unique cards of varying “rarities” to ensure no two drafts play out the same.  Utilize the head to head deck lists published in the rulebook to get right into the game, or choose your favorites from our complete card list to make the constructed deck of your dreams!

Inside the base box of Elementile is a complete 462 card cube (enough for a draft with 6-10 players), 120 element cards (20 of each element), 16 6-sided dice and 64 attack/frozen tokens (for tracking the current board state), two neoprene playmats (for a single 1v1 game board), and a rulebook complete with constructed decklists.

In Elementile, each player has a deck of 40 cards, either pre-constructed or drafted. There are six elements (fire, water, earth, wind, light, and darkness) each with 23 unique cards that players can use to create their decks (limited to 3 copies total of any specific cards). Players summon units and cast spells to control the 4x4 field of play. Your goal is to advance your units across the board to reduce your opponent’s health from 10 to 0.

The last player standing, wins.

Name: Dakalio
Description:
Dakalio is an abstract strategy game for 2 players set in space, the board acts as a planet gravity surface, so it works similar to a spherical board.

Players place Asteroids and move their spaceships around the planet creating paths in order to get crystals and take them out while trying to block each other.

There are 2 ways to trigger end game.

Features:
-High replayability
-Offensive & Defensive win conditions
-Circular linked board
-Path building and blocking
-Exhaustion of pieces
-Portals

Name: Cosmix
Description: An Abstract strategy game for 2 players about spaceships building bases on planets. Theme is only to justify mechanics and visual aspect of the game.

Name: Conspirations
Description:
You reside in the kingdom of Phénistoria.

Vast, sumptuous and undeniably the wealthiest the world has known. 
Until the fateful day when the Great Thenos, king of Phénistoria and hero of the battle of Shred was overthrown by his son Uhl.

Now, 4 factions are trying to regain power: Republicans, Royalists, Satanists and Plague victims.

You will have to play as one of the 14 characters in the game, each with a unique skill that will allow you to cunning, bluff and conspire to succeed in defeating the other factions. With up to 5 different "double jeu" cards representing the dark side of your character as well as a multitude of action cards, you will be able to commit crimes in order to eliminate the other characters and make your faction win.
But beware ! Each crime is punishable by the great Tribunal of Phénistoria. And the tribunal judges are the players (and of course they are flawless and impartial). 
Investigate, uncover the crimes committed by others and persuade the players to follow you in your accusations in order to eliminate your opponents. 
However, beware: In Phénistoria, Justice must be perfect and a bad accusation will lead you directly to prison ...

Citizen of Phénistoria, will you succeed in conquering the Kingdom with the help of your allies?

Name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Messiah Complex
Description:
The decimation of mutants has come to pass and the enemies of the remaining X-Men never rest! In this new Legendary expansion based on the popular Marvel crossover story arc, you will join the ranks of the surviving mutant heroes in a race against new Masterminds and Villains to find a very special child who represents hope for mutants. Play with new schemes and a wealth of content with this 200-card deluxe expansion, which includes the return of sidekicks, back by popular demand. On the verge of extinction and battered by villains, it is up to you to save mutantkind!


     27th Expansion to the vast Legendary Landscape!
     New content: 8 Heroes! 3 Masterminds! 4 Villain groups! 2 Henchmen groups! 4 Schemes, 7 Special Sidekicks, and 3 Special Bystanders!
     Players can work both with and against other players to defeat evil!
     All cards contain original art!
     Requires a Marvel Legendary Core Set to play.

Name: Ultra Vilelence: Module 2
Description:
A fast paced, expandable, random tile, monster generating game with 'questionable' characters and 'vile' enemies. There are multiple ways to play - Deathmatch, Cooperative, Capture the Flag and Solo. Each stand-alone module comes with two unique player characters, monsters and their generators, items, traps and encounters. Includes eight 6.5" x 6.5" tiles for map generation and 162 die cut pieces.

The play area is made up of several randomly drawn floor tiles. Players start at opposite ends of the play area. Players use movement points to move their character through these tiles, defeating monsters and gathering items. Eventually the players' characters will meet and it will be a fight to the death, using the items they gathered along the way. Combat is solved simply with dice (not provided). There are also co-op and solo variant rules available.

Name: Vysočina: otázky a odpovědi
Description:
The new knowledge family game contains 900 questions about VysoÄina region Czech republic.

The questions are divided into four sections, and if you do not know the correct answer, you can help yourself by choosing from three options.

Name: Le storie della famiglia Emozioni
Description:
The Emotions family loves to tell stories. Every night, little Joy and her sister Sadness get together with uncle Anger, uncle Fear and their cousin Disgust and tell each other wonderful stories: can you guess which story each of them is telling? Beware: if you attribute the story to the wrong narrator, the Emotions family may take offence and... make you lose the game!

A game for the whole family, who have to work together to guess which of the tales depicted on the playing cards is being told by a different member of the Emotions family.
The active player draws an Emotion card and must decide which of the five Fairy Tale cards in play best represents it, voting for it in secret. The other players confront each other and try to guess which card has been chosen.
The aim of the game is to finish all the Emotion cards without ever choosing a Fairy Tale card marked with a Flame.

Name: Harry Potter: Race to the Triwizard Cup
Description:
Calling all Harry Potter super-fans! Are you ready for the next Wizarding World adventure with the ultimate Race to the Triwizard Cup? From Dodging the Dragons, landing on Magical Encounters, playing your next Spell Card or passing the Golden Egg, this is the phenomena that will put your inner Wizardry to the test!

The game is basically a luck based die rolling game that has a few cards for the twist.

On a player's turn, the player first plays a card (if have any or want), roll a die and moves according to the die. If a player lands to a spell slot the player draws a spell card and if he/she lands in a magical encounter slot the player draws and reads encounter card and does what it says.

There are also moving dragon tokens that effect the player progression on the board and the spells can push other players backwards or counter other players' spells etc.

When the player goes around the circle he/she gets to the inner circle etc. In the center of the board is the Triwizard Cup and when the player reaches it, the player wins and the game ends.

Name: Radiumtaistelu Marsissa (The Radium Battles on Mars)
Description:
Designed by the creator of Star of Africa, players travel across Mars reach the island city of Horz to find out the whereabouts of the weapon's blueprint, carved on a wall of an ancient temple. From there the race continues to the desert city of Kalat where the blueprint itself is hidden.

The expeditions can proceed by three different routes: by radium canals, submarine routes, or gas tracks. The game is played without a die with cards corresponding to those routes (radium, sukellus, kaasu).

All three different passageways available - radium canals, submarine routes, and gas tracks - have corresponding cards (radium, sukellus, kaasu). Movement on the board is determined by the numbers and letters on each card. The first place to find the weapon, wins.

Name: Empires
Description:
Empires, a medieval, head-to-head combat card game, puts you in command of a kingdom seeking to control the known world. With upgradable units, a vault of gold and an impressive variety of tactical decisions each turn, Empires is an immersive, strategic experience for all ages.

Empires includes several classes of units including infantry, cavalry, archers, and siege carefully balanced through a classic rock-paper-scissors mechanic. Research a plethora of technologies and construct powerful buildings for even more strategy! Construct a formidable deck from a huge collection of cards. Designed for head-to-head gameplay.

All actions taken during your turn cost gold. On your turn, draw cards from either your deck or discard pile, then deploy or construct units and buildings to the battlefield. Once your units and buildings have been strategically placed, engage in combat by attacking your enemy's units and buildings. Attacks are compared to armor and then deteriorate heath of which is tracked with damage counters. Be sure to protect your town center as when it falls you lose the game. To win, either destroy your enemy's town center or have them run out of gold.

Name: Morlox
Description:
Morlox is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty checkered square board. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.

				
				
					DefinitionsTwo stones, or a stone and an empty square, see each other if they lie on the same straight line of orthogonally or diagonally adjacent squares and there are no other stones between them along that line.

You control a square in any of the following situations:


     The square sees stones of your color in three orthogonal directions.
     The square sees stones of your color in two adjacent orthogonal directions and two opposite diagonal directions, provided that each one of the latter directions is adjacent to exactly one of the former.
     The square is on the perimeter of the board and sees stones of your color in two orthogonal directions.


To flip a stone is to replace it with a stone of the opposite color.

				
				
					PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty square not controlled by your opponent or flip an enemy stone on a square you control. Passing is not allowed, but, if you have no moves available, your turn is skipped.

You win if, at the start of your turn, there is a chain of orthogonally adjacent stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.

Name: Camille's Market
Description:
A simple social trading card game made in Kanata and inspired by the markets of the world.

The more players you have, the more the game feels like an early morning at the fruit market in Brazil, a bazaar in the mid-east, or just total chaos...

Get ready to yell louder than the other players to sell your items and snag the ones you want!

Name: Swords around the Throne
Description:
Swords around the Throne allows two players to reenact the Napoleonic Wars (1805-15) on a grand-strategic scale, with France, her dominions and allies pitted in a titanic struggle for Europe against Great Britain and assorted Coalition members.

The players operate as heads of state and commanders-in-chief, not generals or even marshals. Their tools are diplomacy, politics and war. They direct military campaigns, not battlefield tactics.

Setup instructions are provided for “full” games to start in 1805, 1806, 1809, 1812 or 1813. Flexible victory conditions for the full game make it possible to start in any setup year and finish in any year thereafter (though a minimum of 3 years, including the setup year, is recommended). The longer the time frame chosen, the fuller the experience. Substitute victory conditions are offered for "mini" games covering only 1805, 1806, 1809, 1812, 1813-14, 1814 or 1815.

Complexity is medium, and play time ranges from 30 minutes to a few hours, depending on the type of game chosen.

Solo rules are available in the files section.

Name: Scavenger
Description:
Open your box, imagine that you are a consulting detective tasked with solving a particular case, and begin solving your mystery.

When Ernest Whitlock, the head of the Valley Falls Historical Society, is found dead from a gunshot wound inside City Hall. Take up the task that Ernest Whitlock started, play the game the Enigmatic Assembly has set into motion, and be prepared to go into the deepest, darkest places in Valley Falls to find Whitlock’s killer. The Hunt is on!

Name: Murder in 3B
Description:
The Hideaway Motel is one of the seediest places in Valley Falls.  Want to score drugs?  The Hideaway is your place.  Want to buy a handgun that’s had the serial number filed off?  The Hideaway is your place.  Want to step out on your husband?  You guessed it.  The Hideaway.  As a result, nobody is surprised when a girl is found dead in room 3B.  That's the kind of thing that happens regularly here.   You've been asked to consult on the case.  Are you up to the task?  Just about everyone staying at The Hideaway is harboring a secret of some sort, and it's up to you to determine who is responsible for the Murder in 3B.
Difficulty Rating – 5/10

Name: Asylum
Description:
For nearly a century, Saturn Hills Asylum has housed the mentally disturbed of Valley Falls. Under  the leadership of Dr. Norman Blackthorn, Saturn Hills has become known as both a pioneer in experimental psychiatric  techniques as well as a facility equipped to house the most dangerous, demented criminals. Despite the nature of the  sadistic souls held within its walls, Saturn Hills has functioned largely without incident until Wolfgang Koch was  discovered in his room, hanging from the overhead light by a makeshift noose. The way Koch died seems particularly  strange given his history and the reason he was incarcerated at Saturn Hills in the first place. Koch, one of Saturn Hills’ most notorious inmates, was also known as The Judas Killer because he hanged each and every one of his victims and  left a handful of silver coins in the pockets of the deceased as he staged the suicide of Judas Iscariot over and over again. Silver coins, incidentally, were also found at the crime scene. Who had it out for The Judas Killer and what was their  motive for killing him? What kinds of secrets are hidden behind the padded walls of Saturn Hills? Can you discover what was really going on at the asylum and determine who killed Wolfgang Koch?
Difficulty Rating – 6/10

Name: The Wrath of Nero
Description:
It’s been over a year since the psychopath known as Nero last threatened the citizens of Thornmire County. A villain with his own moral code and twisted sense of justice, Nero doled out punishment on those he deemed guilty, mimicking his namesake, the Roman Emperor Nero, who was known for his cruel and unusual methods of torturing those who crossed him. No one had seen or heard from him until earlier today when you received a curious box from Nero, threatening the city of Hampstead with the release of a highly communicable airborne toxin that will likely kill thousands of innocent people if not contained. Nero, however, enjoys the thrill of the chase and the challenge of a worthy opponent. He has provided a series of puzzles that will allow you to pinpoint the location of the  toxin as well as the means to disable the bomb that will disseminate the chemical compound into the atmosphere. He  has allowed you and the other members of the Will Street Detective Agency 72 hours before the population of  Hampstead is wiped off of the map. Oh, and one more thing. Nero has given specific instructions not to contact the  police, the CDC, Homeland Security, or any formal law enforcement agency, threatening to detonate the bomb early if  his instructions aren’t followed. This means your wits and detective skills are the only thing that stands between the  town of Hampstead and a bloody, brutal demise. Discover the secret behind Nero’s wrath and do whatever it takes to save the citizens of Hampstead. 
Difficulty Rating – 7/10

Name: Sleight of Hand
Description:
When The Amazing Silverstone died, his Last Will and Testament was a source of much controversy due to a personalized note he left with his lawyer. It read:

“To my dearest son, Peter. If you are reading this particular draft then it means my unknown nemesis murdered me. They will have gone to great lengths to cover their tracks, but I know the truth. In time, hopefully, you will too. There have been lots of unusual happenings at Silverstone Manor over the past few weeks. Some of them I could have chalked up to simple coincidence, but the sheer number of strange occurrences has cast a sinister cloud overhead that has been too overwhelming to ignore. Your reading of this will proves that I wasn’t paranoid or crazy. I was right all along about the threat on my life. That brings me to your involvement in this cryptic business. In addition to my estate and the considerable wealth that goes with it, I am leaving you the contents of my safe which, I believe, contains the identity of the one who took my life. Over the course of my life I have made many enemies, both personally and professionally, and I believe one of these is to blame for my untimely demise. Determine the identity of my killer and bring them to justice. I have the utmost confidence in you, my son.” 
 Although he had acquired considerable sleight of hand skills from years of apprenticing under his father, Peter Silverstone had no idea where to start with the investigation of his father’s murder. As a result, he has brought the contents of his father’s safe to you at the Will Street Detective Agency and hired you to help solve the mystery surrounding the death of The Amazing Silverstone.

Difficulty Rating – 6/10

Name: Ransom
Description:
Sasha Millington, daughter of real estate magnate Warren Bankhead, was kidnapped during a gala celebrating the opening of the Sioux exhibit at the Valley Falls Museum. A ransom note has been received demanding ten million dollars in exchange for her return. Time is running out. Discover the kidnapper’s true identity and motive for abducting her before it is too late. 
Difficulty Rating – 6/10

Name: Last Resort
Description:
A group of co-workers employed by a Valley Falls travel agency have been given an incredible opportunity. The Refuge at Emerald Island is an isolated and exclusive resort that, ironically, none of the travel agents have ever heard of. What makes this opportunity even more special is that they will be the last group to stay at the tropical resort. The week after their stay, the resort is scheduled to be demolished by its owner and rebuilt as an industrial hub. Once the group arrives, they are excited for sand, sun and relaxation. That quickly changes when a member of their team is found dead with a harpoon in the back. The person who committed the crime must be one of the travel agency guests or the resort staff. Trapped on an island with a bloodthirsty killer, the body count is certain to go up as the suspect list goes down. Will you figure out who the killer is before it’s too late?
Difficulty Rating – 6.5/10

Name: Blast from the Past
Description:
The 80s were a decade of big hair, MTV, video games, outrageous clothing, and fun. The Valley Falls High School “Class of '86” is having a Blast From the Past reunion to relive the glory days of their youth and see old friends that they’ve lost touch with over the years. The reunion is a roaring success until the principal is found strangled to death in his office. Only someone attending the reunion could have killed him. But who? And why? Take a nostalgic step back into the 80s, find out who killed the principal of Valley Falls High School, and experience a Blast From the Past!

Difficulty Rating – 8/10

Name: Beneath the Surface
Description:
A dog wanders up to the front steps of The Will Street Detective Agency. A note has been tucked into his collar. The note is written by a woman named Mary who has been kidnapped and is being held somewhere in town by a maniac who has already killed several other women. Mary has somehow managed to use the dog to carry her request for help, and now it is up to you to find her before it's too late. Retrace the dog's steps, use clues that the dog may have picked up unknowingly, and find the house where Mary is being kept. But beware! There is more to this case than meets the eye. See if you can find what lurks...Beneath the Surface!

Difficulty Rating – 8/10

Name: A Second Chance at Love
Description:
A Deadbolt Mystery Society mini mystery

When the reality TV drama, “A Second Chance at Love,” announced that it would be filming its next season in Valley Falls, excitement was high. As filming started, Aaron Queens, this season’s new bachelor, was already a hit with the ladies. His looks and charm made many of the avid watchers wish they could be on the show as a contestant. But tragedy struck the show during the filming of Wreckage Night, an episode where some of the bachelor’s exes are invited to spend a week with the contestants. After some technical issues, the crew returned to start filming only to find Aaron Queens dead in his room. Will you be able to sift through all of the lies, spite, and romance to find the killer?

Difficulty Rating – 6/10

Name: Sweet Tooth
Description:
A Deadbolt Mystery Society mini mystery.

Investigate the cutthroat world of baking in our newest mini-mystery as a famous food critic is found murdered after planning a visit to Valley Falls to review its finest culinary establishments.

Note:  This is a mystery that is half the size of the normal DMS boxes and takes about half the amount of time to complete. The mini will be delivered in an envelope, not a box.

Difficulty Rating – 5.5/10


    This mystery was never a part of the DMS monthly subscription service. It was released as a one-time purchase

Name: The Spider
Description:
Valley Falls has recently been hit by a wave of strange deaths. Five individuals have perished in accidents, yet a card with the image of a spider was found near each body.  Were these more than mere accidents?  Who is The Spider?  Investigate our newest case and find out!

Difficulty Rating – 6/10

Name: Catch Me If You Can: The Collector – Part 2
Description:
The Collector has returned to finish the grisly business that began last year, and the stakes are higher than ever. The Collector has abducted someone very close to you and has given you a deadline of 24 hours to find them. Failure is not an option. It's time to put an end to The Collector's reign of terror.

Difficulty Rating – 9/10


    This box was never a part of the DMS monthly subscription service.

Name: Return to the Hideaway Motel
Description:
A Deadbolt Mystery Society mini mystery.

Return to the sleepy town of Valley Falls and pull back the dingy curtain to take another look at its sordid underbelly.  Head back to The Hideaway Motel and discover the secrets that a killer called The Magpie left behind.  As you visit one of the most notorious spots in town, uncover one of Valley Falls' most well-kept secrets and do so while trying to avoid a local mafioso hitman who goes by the name of Vito the Smile.

Difficulty Rating – 7/10


    This mystery was never a part of the DMS monthly subscription service. It is half the size of the normal DMS mysteries and takes about half the amount of time to complete.

Name: Cryptic Words
Description:
Cryptic Words is a word guessing game for two players. Each player thinks of a secret word and hides it in plain sight for their opponent to guess using common clues.

The game is played in rounds until someone hits or exceeds 30 points.

In each round, players first grab six hexagonal letter tiles and secretly think of a 3- to 8-letter words and encode and it using a proprietary tracking form. They write down the codes for their word, shuffle their tiles and swap them with their opponent.

Using the game board, players arrange the tiles in any order front of them. The deduction phase starts.

Players take turns rolling two dice and either perform an action on doubles or strategically pose a question. The question will try to pinpoint letters in the opponent's word. Both players must answer the question. The answer may reveal a letter in an opponent's word.

Name: Almanac: The Dragon Road – Merchant's Manifest
Description:
Merchant’s Manifest contains all of the stretch goals unlocked during the Almanac: Dragon Roads Kickstarter campaign.

Includes:
8 Unique Starting Caravans
15 encounter cards
4 Contract cards

Name: Game Jam
Description:
In Game Jam, you’re a game designer trying to make three games: A bloated masterpiece, a reliable gateway game and a mass market cash cow. Your goal is to make the most money you can from these games, as well as win the critical esteem of your peers: the much coveted game of the year award.

In the first part of the game, players will draw three idea cards and play two of them into one of three different rows each turn. Each of these idea cards has a number and a suit and represents a particular theme (e.g. zombies), a mechanic (e.g dice combat) or component (e.g. sand timer). Each theme card bears a unique piece of box art inspired by classic games and each mechanic card features a brief but clear definition.

Using a poker style ranking system, better combinations of ideas score more but each row must also be a higher rank than the one below it. If the players fail to achieve this, they go bust and make no money from their rows. Since the players can’t move ideas cards between rows once placed, they must make careful choices about what combinations they attempt to make. To help them, they can also play up to one development card a turn. Each of these lets them directly manipulate their cards and break game rules to make the most money and win the first part.

In the second part, players may pitch one of their rows as a game to the other players. It must have a title and include all four idea cards in the row in some way into its description. Players will then vote on the game they liked the best and the game with the most votes wins the game of the year award, and the second part of the game. To have the best chance at winning overall, players must weigh-up their investment in maximizing the score of their rows vs how useful they will be for their pitch, if they choose to make one.

Name: The Mara
Description:
Welcome to The Mara, the national reserve of the Maasai people. Your job is to drive tourists across the savannah where they may take photos of animals.

The Mara consists of face down tiles where only the habitat color is known, not the animal symbol. The players take turns to either pick up/drop off tourist cards at lodges or to drive their jeeps and peek at adjacent tiles. The more tourists they have, the less drive actions can they take.

If both color and symbol matches a tourist on picked up card, the player takes a photo by placing a gem on the tourist.

Each tourist has a favourite animal and each animal has its favourite habitat. When all the tourists have been picked up or all the animals have been photographed, the game ends and the player with the most complete sets of animal photos wins.

The Mara combines child-friendly mechanics like deduction, memory and pick-up and delivery with a healthy dose of randomness to provide a fun experience for the entire family. Animal cards tell you where on the map the animals are likely to be found, memorizing the animals you pass help you find them for the next tourist, and skilful jeep driving let you deliver as many tourists to the animals as possible.

—description from the designer

Name: On Shelf
Description:
Systembolaget is a government-owned chain of stores in Sweden with an exclusive right of selling liquor. Its vision is a society where alcoholic beverages are enjoyed with consideration for the health so that nobody is injured. An important aspect of this is that all product selections and displays must be based on customer preferences, and every producer and distributor must be handled the same way.

The items of the store come in three different types of five different colors. The players play job cards to order items to the store, move them to the shelves, pick up customer cards and match them with items on the shelves.

Timely actions will let you work where the store needs it the most and skilful placement of items will bring ”your” customers’ items to the shelves first - both of which will earn you satisfied customers.

The better you execute the jobs, the higher the Customer Satisfaction Index increases. When the store closes, the player with the highest index wins.

The Shelf is a kind of semi-cooperative experience where an action of one player will open (or close) opportunities for the next player. The physical movements of items through the store provides both a tactical experience and a spatial challenge and the card management provide elements of both deck building and turn order manipulation. The result is a highly interactive and tactical game.

—description from the designer

Name: Suecia
Description:
Gustav Vasa has liberated the Swedes from the Danish oppression and risen to the throne. But the new King’s position is weak, as is his Kingdom. Sweden is indebted to the Hansaetic League, Denmark has not given up her claim to the Swedish crown and Europe suffers from religious turmoil.

But this is also an opportunity to start something new. By developing the economy, reforming the taxation and building a national army, Gustav Vasa sets out to consolidate his dynasty and his Kingdom. Take advantage of natural resources, encourage domestic manufacturing, establish overseas markets and engage in profitable wars to pursue the King's will. This is only the foundation of a strong and powerful nation!

Take turns to add estate cards to a card tableau. Each placed estate card lets you execute all the actions of the estate cards in that column.


     Peasant: Place farms or sell resources to shops.
     Burgher: Place shops or use buy basic resources from shops to turn them into advanced resources.
     Clergy: Place churches to collect tax from farms or supply Royal missions with advanced resources.
     Nobility: Add provinces to the Kingdom or supply Royal missions with advanced resources.


Resources enter and exit the city to and from different sides of the city grid. As more advanced resources enter the economy, they can be invested in advanced farms and shops that enable the production of advanced resources within the Kingdom. However, such actions also require a combination of two similar estate cards in the same column so plan your card tableau wisely.

The players who has supplied the most resources to the Royal Missions wins.

Name: C64 Board
Description:
C64 Board is a tribute to the old Commodore 64 games that pleased an entire generation back in the 80s. It's a game system using simple programmable "joystick cards" and generic boards to recreate old C64 games.

Among the games included in the base pack are Tanks (move tanks and fire bouncing shots at opponents), Monsters (move hero and monster with the same action), Maze (find your way through a maze with movable walls), Cars (use gears and turns to race and bump your opponents, Trains (move trains and lay tracks to connect to as many opponent rails as possible), and Snakes (move snakes and try to eat your opponents).

The board consists of 8x8 squares, possibly with additional components depending on the game. Each player has a card tableau of 3x3 joystick cards. The player starts with any 2 cards from any row or column as active joystick cards and play them one at the time to either move in a direction or press a button. The last played card determines the row or column to take up the next 2 cards from. The game proceeds in this manner until its victory condition has been fulfilled.

—description from the designer

Name: Outside: Beyond the SCP facilities
Description:
Somewhere in Belgium the truth machine seems to be rusting away. Where science forgets who it was and logic calculates that it cannot do everything. You don’t know who trust, but cooperation is going to be essential in order to tie the events down and crystallize a coherence for this spreading caos. And of course you are the only person who knows the truth behind the "SCP - db", the Standbeelden.

The SCP Foundation is a fictional international organization that contains and classificates anomalities outside bounds of natural law to prevent mass panic. But, what happens before these events are classified and somehow enprisoned? What if those were free?

This is a game based on the contemporary era and involves suburb investigation on paranormal events along a fractional surrealism. The players get bits and pieces of what’s going on and tie them together, giving different endings to it depending on the interpretations of their character's point of view. The objective is to propose the most coherent scenario in a convincing storyline.

The game starts by dealing Character and Object cards that remain hidden. Then a keyframe card is revealed, this one contains a mysterious image and narrative fragment. All the players pose their questions around it and then take turns to answer them with a small story in order do build coherence. A vote round will determine which storyline wins, staying as the real version of the occurred events. The corresponding player's character then becomes the protagonist who will then explain what the "SCP - db (Standbeelden)" turns out to be. The losers will give an outcome to their character taking into account what the protagonist, the antagonist, the narration, the secondary characters and the items are.

It is better consider this game not as a zero sum game but as a narrative game-tool. An open ended game in which players can also write their own keyframes and subsequently play as many keyframes as they want. Any doubt about the game is to be determined by the people involved.

This game's setting underlines the human ability to cooperate and piece together non-linear narratives in search of further, more rhythmic patterns. Through overinterpretation, eldritchness and speculation. It puts into consideration the next questions: “What is that which we do not acknowledge as a whole?” And “Why does it necessarily and so often have to do with streams of massive delusion?”

—description from the designer

Name: Totems + Taboos
Description:
As one of up to 6 divine players, you create a new religion and convert infidels to believe and obey your commandments.

Gain more followers to build your totem higher and unlock increasingly powerful cards and miracles. Use every trick in the holy book to become the dominant religion and win the game.

During their turn, players can buy and play cards, and build their totem (stacking dice). Their turn ends when they are all out of resources.

A player wins by reaching a level 6 totem (6 dice stacked on top of each other), which ends the game.

Name: Bush's Board Game Thing: The Boardgame
Description:
A board game based around a podcast about boardgames. Given subjects from the board, build up a series of quick-witted rants about board games and produce your own podcast. Be the first to get your rants into the can for later.

The rules are downloaded as part of the game - it's a player vote on the monologue that denotes your move. The first player to complete a rotation of the board wins.

Name: Carta Marina (カルタマリナ)
Description:
Five members of the crew of the Carta Marina, a pirate ship of ill repute, sail through a storm to reunite with their captain, Leon. But the sea monster, the Kraken, wakes up and the ship is attacked and flooded. At the helm of the sinking ship, they arrive at the truth.......

Carta Marina is a co-operative board game for two players. The players are in a pirate ship and constantly have to choose whether to proceed or drain the ship. Will you be able to overcome the threats of waves, floods and whirlpools and reach your destination safely?

On their turn, a player can do up to three actions by playing cards from their hand. There are five actions to choose from:

After completing their actions, players draw cards to determine what hazards the ship will face that round, such as gaping whirlpools, giant waves and floods.

If the players manager to successfully steer, bail and move the ship across the map, they win!

Name: Corona Chase: The Social Distancing Education Game
Description:
RACE TO THE SAFE ZONE: Players race to the safe zone while practicing social distancing and avoiding Corona.

Players move their pieces one space at a time while trying not to be too close to other players pieces.  the first player with 5 emojis across the finish line wins.

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – The Conqueror Worm
Description:
Hellboy: The Board Game – Conqueror Worm adds gameplay elements from the "Conqueror Worm" storyline in the Hellboy comic series to Hellboy: The Board Game.

The Conqueror Worm was part of the original Hellboy: The Board Game Kickstarter but has never been released as a separate expansion before. This is the first time it's been made available in a standalone box, with its own packaging.

This expansion consists of:

2 hero miniature (Lobster Johnson & Roger)
2 agent card
4 Starting cards
1 boss (The Conqueror Worm)
2 case file decks
15 Nazi enemies (3 of each Riflemen, Officers, Machine Gunners, Specialists & Knife Fighters)
10 encounter cards
9 requisition / starting cards
4 double sided game tiles
2 scenery tokens
1 Rules card: New Scenery
6 additional enemy cards
13 additional deck of doom cards
2 additional boss behaviour cards

Name: CubeClimbers
Description:
CubeClimbers is a strategy game for 2-4 players where the objective is to become king of the hill by stacking cubes, pushing opponents, tossing grappling hooks, and using superpowers. The cubes in this game magnetically snap together for a modular and sturdy 3D board. Climbing to the top requires creativity, tactics, precision, diplomacy, and risk-taking.

Setup: Players start on a base of prearranged cubes. Each player is then dealt an even and equal number of the remaining cubes. Players are also dealt a combination of 2 unique player powers face down that can each be used once a game.

Play: During their turn, players build 2 cubes, move to an adjacent space, and roll. Rolling gives players a chance to reposition with the grappling hook (1/2 chance) or push all players in a direction of their choice with wind (1/6 chance). Players must perform all three actions once in any order to end their turn and may also use their powers as optional actions. The game keeps going until the player who builds the last remaining cube ends their turn.

Winning: The player at the highest level of the mountain when the game ends wins!

Name: Global Holdings
Description:
Global Holdings is a Monopoly clone.

It includes all of the elements of classic Monopoly but the setting is the entire world. The properties cost more and you'll build apartments instead of houses before moving on to hotels.

The winner is the one to amass the most property thus driving their opponents into bankruptcy.

Name: Yeti Trek
Description:
Yeti Trek is a quick, medium-weight game for 2 players. Race across a vast mountain range and be the first yeti to reach the summit to win!

The flow of Yeti Trek is as follows:
1. One player rolls all 6 dice and splits the dice into 2 groups
2. The other player choose which group of dice they want. The remaining group goes to the first player.
3. Use your dice to move your Yeti meeple across the mountain range. To move on the mountain range, the space that you end your movement on must match the color of the dice that you discarded. In addition, the total value of the dice discarded must be equal to or greater than the total on all the spaces that you moved through this turn.

Optionally utilize a rondel every turn before you move to gain bonuses to your movement.

Once both players have used all of their dice, the round is over and a new round starts. The game ends immediately once one players reaches one of the Summit spaces.

Name: Flatten the Curve
Description:
Flatten The Curve is an entertaining board game for kids and adults alike, bringing virus safety-awareness through play.
A horrible illness is attacking your city! Will you forget your mask and get infected? Be smart, stay sharp, and move fast to get you and your family out of the pandemic - safe and healthy.

Players roll dice and move their families around a Monopoly-like board. Event cards add twists to the game.  But be careful, some space can cause you to get sick and have to go into quarantine!

The first person to move all 5 of their family around the board, wins.

Name: Infinite Chaos
Description:
Infinite Chaos is an out-of-this-world card game where you work with friends and family to create the craziest way to solve a problem or create one.

Players start by designating a Chaosmaster (Judge) to create an objective involving a chaos card ranging from serious issues like world hunger to more light-hearted ones such as family reunions. Everyone else draws questionable idea cards, random components to aid you in formulating your soon-to-be master plan, which they will use to compete against others to meet the Chaosmaster's objective. The Chaosmaster will then award the chaos card to whoever's plan was the best. A new Chaosmaster is then selected, and a winner is decided by whoever has the most chaos cards when the game ends.

Name: Keys to the Ice Castle
Description:
Keys to the Ice Castle is a tile-based game of strategy and luck. Based on the Keys to the Castle game players choose a knight token and then race through a tile based maze to get to the other side.

By opening and locking doors (the tiles) each player can help him or herself while hindering their opponents. Use the special cards such as the axe, magic wand, slide, or freeze to add even more to the gameplay.

The game is easy to learn and quick to play. With the tiles acting as the "board", there is a new outcome to each game every time the tiles and cards are shuffled.

—description from the publisher

Name: Diplomaten-Spiel
Description:
For each number of players, there are starting positions given. The goal of the game is to block enemy pieces by jumping on top of them.

Movement is to any empty neighboring space which is connected to the starting space by a line. An enemy piece may be captured by jumping over it to an empty space behind it. The captured space is stacked under the attacking piece or stack. The piece on top moves the entire stack. When a stack is jumped over, only the piece on top is captured. Capturing may be perormed in a series of jumps.

To win the game one has to immobilize all enemy pieces by being on top all other pieces.

Name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Champion Cards
Description:
A set of 5 cards that were provided as participation reward in the last European, North American and World Championships.

These 5 cards were designed by previous Continental/World championship winners as part of their prize, but were never included in the Force Packs before the end of the game was announced.

Each of these cards can be used to replace a card with the same set-number in any objective set.

Cards in this set are:
Aurra Sing — 2016 North American Champ Josh Johnson
Darth Vader — 2016 World Champion Brad Emon
It’s Beautiful — 2017 World Champion Mick Cipra
K-2SO — 2017 European Champion Pawel Zochowski
Profundity — 2017 North American Champion James Lau

These cards are also available in a Print to Play file through the FFG site.

Name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Promo Cards
Description:
A set of 17 new cards that were revealed as daily milestones during Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition Kickstarter campaign.

Corporation Cards (6):

     Arklight
     Celestior
     DevTechs
     Launch Star Incorporated
     Mai-Ni Productions
     Zatesel


Project Cards (11):

     Assorted Enterprises
     Commercial Imports
     Diverse Habitats
     Filter Feeders
     Laboratories
     Matter Generator
     Processed Metals
     Processing Plant
     Progressive Policies
     Synthetic Catastrophe
     Self-Replicating Bacteria

Name: War For Chicken Island: Yolk Sothoth
Description:
Yolk Sothoth is a Kickstarter exclusive mini for War For Chicken Island for 1 to 4 players.

Suggested by backers, created by Draco Studios & Detestable Games.

Name: War For Chicken Island: Dragon Mama
Description:
Dragon Mama is a mini with Leader Card for War For Chicken Island, and comes with two Dragon Hatchling minis and unit cards.

Suggested by backers, created by Draco Studios & Detestable Games.

Name: War For Chicken Island: Kickstarter Exclusive Stretch Goals
Description:
This set contains the various stretch goals from the Kickstarter campaign:
- 5th Player Components
- 4 exclusive Leaders (Krestos, Caldor, Helena, Roatinator C-800) and one Unit (Mega Chicken Dragon) with their cards
- Additional Scroll cards
- Wooden pilot meeples
- Cloth draw bag

Name: Alphabet Runner Games
Description:
The game is created by the winner of the Best Family Game Award - UK Games Expo 2007

Alphabet Runner Games is 3 games in 1 set of cards.

     MaxxRas. Word game which contains 10 levels. Age 11 - 99 
     Pairs. A memory recall game. Age 10+
     Snap. Popular, fast-paced card game. Age 9+


MaxxRas: Players begin at level 1 and build/create/form 3 or 4 letter words and progress to level 10 and build/create/form 15 or more letter words. MaxxRas is simple to begin and then through the levels becomes one of the most challenging word games in the world. There is lots of room for progression as it gets harder each time more letters are needed to make a word. MaxxRas is probably the only word game in the world that allows the players the opportunity of building/creating/forming a 45 letter word – “pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanokoniosis” whilst playing Level 10. MaxxRas is for the word game fans in the family and for the players that like being challenged. It’s an ideal travel game.

Deal 7 random cards to each player. Place 3 or 4 cards face-up randomly and then place level 1 card next to the cards in the Centre play area.
Level 1 is to create 3 or 4 letter words. Take turns to build a word by using at least 1 alphabet letter from 1 of your own cards and using letters from the other cards in the Centre play area. Once a player has created a word, place the card separately from the other cards in the Centre play area and then reveal/confirm the word to the other players to avoid picking up an additional card from the deck. Then place that card on top of any card in the Centre play area.

The first player to get rid of their cards outright wins that level. The player that wins the most number of levels is the MaxxRas winner.
Full details and videos on how to play MaxxRas word game in minutes is available on the MaxxRas YouTube Channel.

Game 2
Pairs. A memory recall game.

Game 3
Snap. Popular, fast-paced card game.

Name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: The Deep
Description:
The second cycle of the "Monsters" series features underwater sea monsters from classical and modern mythology, ranging from Nessie and Captain Nemo up to the Leviathan (Midgard Serpent) and The Old One. All monsters and tactical cards (neutralizers) have unique powers from the other cycles.

Each monster has an ability such as triggering the top card of your discard pile. You don't play cards from your hand; you take cards from a 4-card pool and trigger the card as you take it. At the end of the game players discard down to their best 2 cards. Then, tactical cards (neutralizers) destroy their corresponding monsters, and the player with the best surviving combination of cards wins.

Draw a card from the Pool, say its name and number aloud, and trigger/resolve its primary ability. (If another card gets triggered, reveal it and resolve it.) Fill the Pool back to 4 from the face-down deck. At the end of your turn, if you exceed your hand limit (3 cards), discard excess cards face-down to your discard pile. When the draw deck is empty, continue taking turns until everyone has had an equal number. Then Resolution begins.

RESOLUTION (combine / score your 2 cards)
All players discard down to just 2 cards. In turn order, each player dramatically reveals their highest-number card. Then they reveal their other card. Resolve all Neutralizers. The player with the highest total score wins the game. If there is a tie, the tied player with the highest-value surviving Monster is the winner.

At the end the game have the highest combined point total between your final 2 cards to win.

Name: The Royal Court
Description:
For centuries, rulers have ruled their Kingdoms with the support of a royal court. A royal comprised of the Kings closest and most trusted family, advisors and nobles. A Kingdom lived or died on the strength of their Kingdoms royal court.

In The Royal Court, players take on the role of royal advisors to their respective kingdoms. Each advisor has been tasked with gathering trusted individuals to join their own kingdom's court.

The Royal Court is played in a series of rounds. Over the course of a round, players fill their royal courts with trusted royals, clergy, servants, and of course the Kings and Queens themselves.

The object of The Royal Court is be the first player to win 3 rounds. To win a round, a player must assemble the highest scoring royal court.

Players take alternate turns drawing cards and performing actions. When the deck empty the round is over

To play a turn, players perform the following actions in order:

The first player draws the top 4 cards of the deck and forms 2 pairs of their choice face-up next to the draw pile.

The second player chooses which pair of cards they receive and which pair the other player receives.

Both players take and place their assigned pair of cards face-down in a single pile in front of them. This is their court. Now starting with the second player, repeat the above steps until the deck is empty.

When there are no more cards left to draw, each players score their own royal court for the current round. The player with the most points wins the round.

The first player to win 3 rounds is the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Exodus
Description:
Campaign with your friends through each mission to unlock the secrets of the Xenohunter universe. Where did these mutative effects come from? How could an alien outbreak such as this spread so quickly? Is there something more sinister behind their sudden appearance? ... do your team know more than they say?

—description from the publisher

A choose-your own adventure style game.

Name: Pokémon TCG: V Battle Deck – Venusaur vs. Blastoise
Description:
Engage in a Pokémon Trading Card Game battle with the might of Pokémon V on your side in the V Battle Deck—Venusaur vs. Blastoise. This ready-to-play double deck bundle contains two full decks of 60 cards, one starring Venusaur V and one with Blastoise V. You and a friend can jump right into a match to see who will come out on top. This set also includes eight additional Trainer cards that can be used to bolster your deck. Not only that, but there are also useful accessories like playmats, damage counters, metallic coins, and deck boxes to enhance your experience. You can even improve your skills with guides to upgrading your deck and unlocking winning strategies, plus reference cards to make the game even easier to play. Choose your deck and prepare for battle!

—description from the publisher
